Here is the step function execution I found was causing issues

https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:be12a3e1-4b7d-46e8-9113-1dfdf4fb20ad

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595945829246,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-201","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-100","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I've identified that this was due to a quota applying to AWS step functions - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/step-functions/latest/dg/limits.html#service-limits-task-executions - where there's a limit of 32,768 characters for the JSON state passed from one task to another.
When a large number of photos was being processed, particularly when some of them were causing Xact errors by there being "illegal" characters in their filenames, the overall result state being passed between task steps was exceeding the 32,768 quota, mainly when processing the final outcome to pass back to OnDemand.
I've now optimised the JSON state data passed between tasks to reduce its size so batches of up to approx. 150 attachments should be processed without the quota being exceeded.
As has been discussed with @Garth Murray, it will be advisable to set some limit in OnDemand on the number of attachments that can be sent at once to Xact, e.g. perhaps not more than 150 per batch, particularly sicne it's recently been observed that photos are being sent of between 5MB and 7MB each, so sending a batch of 100 of those is a significant amount of data to be transferring to Xact (and the Xact API is very slow to receive/process each individual attachment).

Test/live API endpoints are the same as for attachments, notes, reassignment, and using the same API key:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/setstatus

The body of the POST is JSON in this form:
{
"status": "Appointment Scheduled",
"datetime": "2020-07-24T12:34:56Z",
"userId": "cheywood"
}

The call is processed and forwarded over to Xact immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body of this form: {"error": "invalid status"}.

Valid statuses are:
Job Started
Job Completed
Contacted
Appointment Scheduled
Appointment Cancelled
Planned Inspection
Inspected
Not Sold
Reviewed
Rejected
QA Rejected
QA Approved
Client Approved
Client Rejected
File Closed
File Reopened

If a time zone is not specified with the datetime then it is presumed to be UTC.

The userid is required (and is not the same as an XactNet address).

\App\Http\Controllers\PdfController holds the current start point for making a pdf to view, you can use this to test things.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\PDFBuilder holds all the stuff for actually creating a PDF.

\App\Console\Commands\CreateAssignmentPdfs::handle contains a block of PDFs to be generated and saved, simply add the invoice one to that list and you'll be good.

\App\Components\PDFBuilder\CreatePDF::getPDF contains the actual code to generate the PDF

Here's how to call the new API:

Same end points you're using for the attachments and notes, i.e.:
https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/ for test and https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/ for live, using the same API key you're using already.

POST to /ondemand[TEST]/assignments/{transactionID}/reassign

The body of the POST is this form of JSON:
{
"XNAddress": "GLOBAL.SARASOTA.FL.TEST",
"XM8UserId": "CH"
}

As with the Notes endpoint the call is going to be processed and forwarded over to Xact immediately and will straightaway either return 200 Success or 400 error. When there's an error there'll be a JSON body like this: {"error": "no XNAddress"}.

You'll note there's an XM8UserId attribute in the JSON. That's actually optional, i.e. you can just send the XNAddress and leave out the XM8UserId attribute altogether. BUT, I've discussed this with Elizabeth at Xact and she says "You don’t necessarily have to send over the XM8 userid, but it will default to the main user on the account, and instead of going directly to the assigned user the assignment will show up under ‘all projects’, if that makes sense." Which doesn't actually make a whole lot of sense to me! But I think we just need to try it in the live environment and see how it comes through in Xact when you just send, say, an XNAddress of GLOBAL.EV.JUSTIN.SARASOTA.FL.2 without a XM8UserId.
